name: activation
description: When first starting a Bubble from scratch, it needs to be activated. Packer images are also needed to launch new Bubbles.

externalDocs.description: More information about activation is available in the Bubble Launch Guide

name: auth
description: These API endpoints are all about registration, login, and logout. Various actions in Bubble also require approval from a verified contact, those API calls are described here as well.

externalDocs.description: More information about authentication is available in the Bubble API Guide

name: account
description: Manage account settings and policies, download or delete an account, and more.

name: account_objects
description: Most objects in the Bubble world are owned by an account. These are the CRUD APIs used to manage them.

name: apps
description: These APIs are about managing your Bubble apps from your Bubble.

name: app_runtime
description: These APIs are called by apps that your Bubble has activated for various requests.

name: backup_restore
description: APIs used during backup and restore operations.

name: clouds
description: APIs for launching Bubbles and accessing cloud services.

name: devices
description: Device management. Add, connect, and remove devices. View device status and more.

externalDocs.description: More information about devices is available in the Bubble API Guide

name: mitmproxy
description: mitmproxy uses these APIs to coordinate with Bubble and enhance your internet experience.

name: node
description: Bubbles communicate with each other using these APIs.

name: node_manager
description: The nodemanager is a low-level service that helps monitor CPU, memory and disk usage, and in recovery situations.

name: payment
description: Payment APIs are disabled by default. For more information about using Bubble with payments enabled, contact licensing@getbubblenow.com

name: search
description: Search objects in the Bubble database.
